snippet: North Korea’s threat to put all its nuclear facilities to use, including a reactor shuttered in a disarmament deal, came after a series of bellicose statements.
abstract: North Korea announces plans to restart mothballed nuclear reactor, latest in series of provocations by Kim Jong-un to elicit response from United States; American officials believe they can wait out threats, believing that North Korea will eventually back down, but worry about consequences of miscalculation.

byline.original: By CHOE SANG-HUN and MARK LANDLER
byline.contributor: Choe Sang-hun reported from Seoul, and Mark Landler from Washington.

lead_paragraph: North Korea’s threat to put all its nuclear facilities to use, including a reactor shuttered in a disarmament deal, came after a series of bellicose statements.

headline.main: North Korea Says It Will Restart Reactor to Expand Arsenal
headline.print_headline: North Korea Says It Will Restart Mothballed Nuclear Reactor
